remarks: Given a finite multiplication of values betweeen 0 and 1, a value ` E ` larger than any multiplicand, is larger than the whole multiplication. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
fmul01lt1lem2.1 $e |- F/_ i B $.
fmul01lt1lem2.2 $e |- F/ i ph $.
fmul01lt1lem2.3 $e |- A = seq L ( x. , B ) $.
fmul01lt1lem2.4 $e |- ( ph -> L e. ZZ ) $.
fmul01lt1lem2.5 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ( ZZ>= ` L ) ) $.
fmul01lt1lem2.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. ( L ... M ) ) -> ( B ` i ) e. RR ) $.
fmul01lt1lem2.7 $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. ( L ... M ) ) -> 0 <_ ( B ` i ) ) $.
fmul01lt1lem2.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. ( L ... M ) ) -> ( B ` i ) <_ 1 ) $.
fmul01lt1lem2.9 $e |- ( ph -> E e. RR+ ) $.
fmul01lt1lem2.10 $e |- ( ph -> J e. ( L ... M ) ) $.
fmul01lt1lem2.11 $e |- ( ph -> ( B ` J ) < E ) $.
fmul01lt1lem2 $p |- ( ph -> ( A ` M ) < E ) $.
$d J i $.
$d L i $.
$d M i $.
